bg.x2d

Class ImageUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • bg.x2d.ImageUtils

  • public class ImageUtils
extends Object
    Provides static convenience methods for performing geometric operations on images.
    Since:
    2DX 1.0 (1st Edition)
    Author:
    Brian

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

    • Method Detail

      • rotateImage

        public static AffineTransform rotateImage(Image img,
                          Point location,
                          double degrees)
        Returns a rotated AffineTransform object that can be used to rotate an image.
        Parameters:
        img - The Image to be rotated
        location - The location of the Image in the 2D coordinate space
        degrees - The number of degrees to rotate
        Returns:
        the rotated (and translated) AffineTransform

      • rotateImage

        public static AffineTransform rotateImage(Image img,
                          Point location,
                          Graphics2D g2d,
                          double degrees)
        Draws a rotated version of the given Image to the specified Graphics2D object.
        Parameters:
        img - The Image to be rotated
        location - The location of the Image in the 2D coordinate space
        g2d - The Graphics2D object on which to draw the new rotated image.
        degrees - The number of degrees to rotate
        Returns:
        the rotated (and translated) AffineTransform

      • rotateImage

        public static AffineTransform rotateImage(Image img,
                          Point location,
                          double theta,
                          boolean radians)
        Returns a rotated AffineTransform object that can be used to rotate an image.
        Parameters:
        img - The Image to be rotated
        location - The location of the Image in the 2D coordinate space
        theta - Rotation value
        radians - true if theta should be interpreted as a radian value, false if theta should be interpreted as a degree value.
        Returns:
        the rotated (and translated) AffineTransform

      • rotateImage

        public static AffineTransform rotateImage(Image img,
                          Point location,
                          Graphics2D g2d,
                          double theta,
                          boolean radians)
        Draws a rotated version of the given Image to the specified Graphics2D object.
        Parameters:
        img - The Image to be rotated
        location - The location of the Image in the 2D coordinate space
        g2d - The Graphics2D object on which to draw the new rotated image.
        theta - Rotation value
        radians - true if theta should be interpreted as a radian value, false if theta should be interpreted as a degree value.
        Returns:
        the rotated (and translated) AffineTransform

      • scaleImage

        public static AffineTransform scaleImage(Image img,
                         Point location,
                         Dimension newSize)
        Performs a AffineTransform scaling operation relative to the generic Image provided. The returned AffineTransform can be used to draw a scaled version of the Image on screen. High quality is not guaranteed.
        Parameters:
        img - The Image to be scaled.
        location - The location the Image should be drawn at.
        newSize - The dimensions the scaled Image should be.
        Returns:
        a scaled and translated AffineTransform that can be used to draw a scaled version of the Image.

      • scaleImage

        public static BufferedImage scaleImage(Image img,
                       Dimension newSize,
                       ImageUtils.ScaleQuality quality)
        Takes any generic Image and scales it to a new size. The returned Image is a BufferedImage upon which the scaled image is drawn upon. This method calls scaleImage(img, newSize, BufferedImage.TYPE_INT_ARGB, highQuality).
        Parameters:
        img - Any generic Image or Image subclass to be scaled (doesn't affect the BufferedImage type of the returned image).
        newSize - the dimensions for the new Image.
        Returns:
        a BufferedImage with the scaled Image drawn onto it.

      • scaleImage

        public static Image scaleImage(Image img,
               Dimension newSize)
        Legacy method. Calls standard image scaling method with ScaleQuality.NORM. scaleImage(Image,Dimension,ScaleQuality) should be preferred.
        Parameters:
        img -
        newSize -
        Returns:

      • scaleImage

        public static BufferedImage scaleImage(Image img,
                       Dimension newSize,
                       int imgType,
                       ImageUtils.ScaleQuality quality)
        Takes any Image and scales it to a new size. This method draws the image onto a BufferedImage of the specified size. Various rendering operations are set depending on the value of quality.
        Parameters:
        bi - The Image to be scaled.
        newSize - The new size for the image
        imgType - The new BufferedImage type (defined in the BufferedImage class)
        quality - The scaling quality of the newly rendered image.
        Returns:
        the image scaled and drawn onto a BufferedImage

      • scaleBufferedImage

        public static BufferedImage scaleBufferedImage(BufferedImage img,
                               Dimension newSize,
                               int imgType,
                               int scaleType)
        Legacy method. Provided for backwards compatibility.
        Parameters:
        scaleType - Note that this argument is ignored in the modern implementation of this method.
        Returns:
        BufferedImage scaled using the preferred scaleImage(Image,Dimension,int,ScaleQuality) method.

      • convertBufferedImage

        public static BufferedImage convertBufferedImage(BufferedImage bi,
                                 int outType)
        Converts a BufferedImage to the specified type by drawing it onto a new BufferedImage. The data and dimensions of the given image are preserved.
        Parameters:
        bi - The BufferedImage to convert.
        outType - The type of BufferedImage that should be returned.
        Returns:
        the new BufferedImage of type outType that is a copy of bi

      • convertImage

        public static BufferedImage convertImage(Image img,
                         int outType)
        Converts any Image to a BufferedImage of the specified type. The data and dimensions of the given Image are preserved.
        Parameters:
        img - The Image to convert.
        outType - The type of BufferedImage that should be returned.
        Returns:
        the new BufferedImage of type outType that is a copy of img

      • getNativeImage

        public static BufferedImage getNativeImage(int wt,
                           int ht)
        Convenience method to create a native platform compatible BufferedImage. A native image will, in most cases, boost performance.
        Parameters:
        wt - width of the image
        ht - height of the image
        g - Graphics object to obtain the device configuration from
        Returns:
        the newly created BufferedImage object

      • getNativeImage

        public static BufferedImage getNativeImage(Image orig)
        Convenience method to create a native platform compatible BufferedImage. A native image will, in most cases, boost performance.
        Parameters:
        wt - width of the image
        ht - height of the image
        g - Graphics object to obtain the device configuration from
        Returns:
        the newly created BufferedImage object

      • getNativeImageType

        public static int getNativeImageType()

      • createVolatileImage

        public static VolatileImage createVolatileImage(int wt,
                                int ht)
        Convenience method for creating a new compatible VolatileImage using the given Graphics context.
        Parameters:
        wt - the width of the new image
        ht - the height of the new image
        Returns:
        the newly created, fully compatible VolatileImage.
        See Also:
        VolatileImage

      • validateVI

        public static int validateVI(VolatileImage vi,
             Graphics g)
        Convenience method that calls the validate(...) method on the given VolatileImage using the GraphicsConfiguration returned by ((Graphics2D)g).getDeviceConfiguration().
        Parameters:
        vi - the VolatileImage to be validated.
        g - the Graphics object to use for the GraphicsConfiguration.
        Returns:
        an integer value specified by the GraphicsConfiguration class.
        See Also:
        VolatileImage
